intro: Faramea nigrescens, commonly known as black faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are an important food source for various bird species. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid forests, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture with a glossy appearance.
